pageContext.claim: “So if they got in, you would be, 'cause that was really heading down fast, and as you know it was the worst recovery since the Great Depression. If they got in, instead of being up almost 50 per cent, which it is, the stock market.”
pageContext.analysis: On the day of this interview, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 33 percent since Trump took the oath of office, while the Standard & Poor's 500 Index was up about 28 percent.
